entry.title: Broccoli
entry.summary: Broccoli is good and healthy raw, cooked or dried but better to serve cooked.

entry.title: Cucumber
entry.summary: Common food for ratties, can be served cooked or raw. The peal is usually disliked by rats but is not harmful.

entry.title: Peas
entry.summary:
Common food for ratties, can be served cooked, raw or frozen.
Very good during winter seasons.

entry.title: Apple
entry.summary: Apples are great and healthy, except for the seeds which are poisonous, so be sure to remove those!

entry.title: Apricot
entry.summary: Apricots are good and healthy. There's nothing unusual about this item.

entry.title: Avocado
entry.summary:
Avocado is delicious and ratties love it, however it's very high in fat and should only be served in small amounts.
The skin is poisonous for ratties, so make sure to avoid that!

entry.title: Bananas
entry.summary: Bananas are great and healthy, can be served raw, mashed up and dried.

entry.title: Beat Tops
entry.summary: Can cause urinary tract problems and stones in the kidneys and bladder due to their extremely high levels of oxalates.

entry.title: Blackbarries
entry.summary: Bananas are great and healthy, can be served raw, mashed up and dried.

entry.title: Blue Cheese
entry.summary: The mold that is used to make blue cheese is toxic for rats.

entry.title: Boysenberries
entry.summary: Berries in general are okay for ratties. Beware of the mess though, it might color the surroundings and the fur of the ratty.

entry.title: Brussel Sprouts
entry.summary: Raw Brussel sprouts ar poisonous, however steamed or cooked is okay!

entry.title: Caffeine
entry.summary: Caffeine is unhealthy substance in general, ratty hearts are small and are affected severely.

entry.title: Carbonated Drinks
entry.summary: Rats cannot burp so carbonated drinks will make them really uncomfortable. Also often carbonated drinks have a lot of sugar which is bad for rats.

entry.title: Green Beans
entry.summary: Green Beans can be delicious and healthy, they have a lot of nutrients and low calories. Make sure to avoid spices, including salt (though a pinch is ok).

entry.title: Kiwi
entry.summary: Kiwis are ok to in moderation since they are quite sour and contain a lot of seeds.

entry.title: Licorice
entry.summary: Contains neurotixins and usually very high on sugars as well.

entry.title: Mango
entry.summary: Contains d-limonene which can cause kidney cancer in male rats.

entry.title: Onion
entry.summary: Rats will probably not gonna touch it, but nevertheless should be avoided. It might cause anemia and in general upset the stomach.

entry.title: Orange
entry.summary: The white part on the peelings and outer layer of a peeled orange is harmful to male rats. It seems to be ok for females, but I just stay away from citrus fruits in general.

entry.title: Papaya
entry.summary: Papaya is good when served in moderation.

entry.title: peach
entry.summary: Peaches are good and healthy bewar of the stone.

entry.title: Peanuts
entry.summary: Raw nuts and seeds in general are toxic or at least unhealthy.

entry.title: Pear
entry.summary:
Pears are great and healthy, except for the seeds which are poisonous, so be sure to remove those!
Pears are very generic and can be served raw, cooked or dried.

entry.title: Plum
entry.summary: Plums are good and healthy bewar of the stone. Better serve ripe, since sour ones can upset the stomach.

entry.title: Pomegranates
entry.summary:
Pomegranates are usually healthy and good when served in moderation, high doses might upset stomach.
Take note that they are quite messy and might dye the fur and surroundings red.

entry.title: Poppey Seeds
entry.summary: There is some evidence that it makes ratties lethargic, in general it's not a good food.

entry.title: Raspberries
entry.summary: Berries in general are okay for ratties. Beware of the mess though, it might color the surroundings and the fur of the ratty.

entry.title: Raw Beans
entry.summary: Raw beans should be avoided since they destroy vitamin A and digestion enzymes which can cause red blood cells to clump up.

entry.title: Red Cabbage
entry.summary: Only good when cooked or steamed, raw ones will upset the stomach.

entry.title: Rhubarb
entry.summary: High levels of oxalates which bind up calcium. Also very sour which will upset the stomach.

entry.title: Sugar
entry.summary:
Sugar is unhealthy and although it won't kill the ratty it will make it fat and can introduce other health issues.
Try avoiding it as much as possible and instead include foods that have natural sugars like apples or bananas.

entry.title: Sweet Potato
entry.summary: Only good when cooked or steamed, raw ones will upset the stomach.

entry.title: Tofu
entry.summary: Raw is bad, but packaged is okay.

entry.title: Bread
entry.summary: Testing bread

entry.title: Carrot
entry.summary: Carrot is a great vegetable for ratties. Good raw, cooked and dried, though raw should be served in moderation, can upset stomach in high doses.

entry.title: Grapes
entry.summary:
Grapes don't have high nutritional value but overall they are healthy and good to serve. Purple grapes are believed to prevent cancer as well.
Should be served in moderation since grapes contain a lot of natural sugars.

entry.title: Lemon
entry.summary: Testing lemon

entry.title: Potato
entry.summary: Testing potato
